titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the National Ubu Roi Bake-Off Collection
titlestmt.author: by Kristen E. Muenz

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:47
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English.

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The National Ubu Roi Bake-Off Collection consists of thirty-six plays written during a grassroots event organized by the playwright Paula Vogel. The event took place on President's Day, February 19, 2018.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift from various sources, 2018. For more information, consult the appropriate curator.

bioghist.head: National Ubu Roi Bake-Off
bioghist.p: The National Ubu Roi Bake-Off was a grassroots event organized by playwright Paula Vogel. A bake-off is a writing exercise that requires its participants to write a piece on an assigned theme with assigned elements within 48 hours. Participants then gather and stage readings of their pieces.

On President's Day, February 19, 2018, playwrights and community members gathered for a bake-off inspired by Ubu Roi, a play by Alfred Jarry that opened and closed on December 10, 1896. Eighteen bake-offs were listed on Paula Vogel's website at locations across the United States, with one bake-off in Canada; many more informal bake-off gatherings also occurred.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: National Ubu Roi Bake-Off Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The National Ubu Roi Bake-Off Collection consists of thirty-six plays written during a grassroots event organized by the playwright Paula Vogel. The event took place on President's Day, February 19, 2018.
Information about location and the affiliated event has been included where it was provided by the authors of the plays.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The National Ubu Roi Bake-Off Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

did.unittitle: "Oh What a Pig You Are, Pa Ubu."

bioghist.head: Karen Helfand Bix
bioghist.p: Karen Helfand Bix is also known as Kit Bix.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This play was performed in a staged reading for the Ubu Roi Bake-Off event at The Playwrights Center in Minneapolis, MN.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Sharai Bohannon, Ben Brinkley, Diana Burbano, Greg Burdick, Rachael Carnes, and Jordan Elizabeth Henry, 2018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This play was written by six authors based in different locations: Sharai Bohannon (Chicago, IL), Ben Brinkley (Eugene, OR), Diana Burbano (Los Angeles, CA), Greg Burdick (Lakeland, FL), Rachael Carnes (Eugene, OR), and Jordan Elizabeth Henry (Chattanooga, TN).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains information printed off websites about the event: eight pages from Paula Vogel's website and one page from a blog post soliciting Bake-Off scripts for the collection, posted by Melissa Barton, the Curator of Prose and Drama for the Yale Collection of American Literature.
